Reason: The configuration 'unlogged_batch_across_partitions_warn_threshold' is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts system performance by identifying potentially problematic batch operations that may cause performance issues or data consistency problems. The configuration triggers a warning when a batch operation is unlogged and spans across more partitions than the specified threshold, which indicates time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. This can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
